meanings.definition: The ability to be expanded or enlarged.
meanings.sent1: The toy's expandability allowed it to grow bigger when more pieces were added.
meanings.sent2: The expandability of the storage unit made it easy to increase its capacity.
meanings.sent3: The balloon's expandability was put to the test when it was filled with helium and floated away.
meanings.sent4: Her mind had an expandability that seemed limitless, always ready to take in new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The expandability of the rubber band was impressive as it stretched to twice its original size.

meanings.definition: The quality of being capable of expansion.
meanings.sent1: The expandability of the fabric allowed for comfortable movement without tearing.
meanings.sent2: The expandability of the business was evident in its ability to open new branches quickly.
meanings.sent3: The cake's expandability surprised everyone as it rose beautifully in the oven.
meanings.sent4: His expandability in learning new languages was like a sponge soaking up water.
meanings.sent5: The expandability of the balloon animal made it a hit at the party, as it could be twisted into various shapes.
